intro: Bupleurum ranunculoides f. syntomum, commonly known as the dwarf buttercup, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is a compact, herbaceous perennial characterized by its small, bright yellow flowers and finely divided leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is native to regions of Europe and western Asia. Its foliage and floral structure are similar to other members of the genus Bupleurum, but it is distinguished by its shorter stature and more compact growth habit. This subspecies is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ease of care.
